data.content:
The Host interface is a bit messy and busy when they are both hosting and playing the game...

We should change it so they dont have the question and answers displayed in a non-interactive chunk first, then displayed so we can choose an answer and lock it in right below that - its confusing. Let's have just the answering section displayed (and add colours to the options like other players get). 

There's some other work going on right now, so before you make changes please assess current state and offer me your plan
Let me examine the current state of the Host session interface.
data.reasoningText:
The user wants me to look at the Host interface when the host is also playing the game. They're saying there's a duplicate display of the question and answers - one non-interactive and one interactive. They want me to assess the current state and propose a plan before making changes.

Let me look at the relevant files - primarily `HostSession.tsx` and possibly related components.

data.content: Now let me look at the specific rendering sections — the non-interactive question display and the host-as-player answering section:
Now let me see how `isHostPlayer` and `hostDisplayName` are determined, and also look at the broader context around the question display:
Now let me see the full "playing" state section and how showing/hiding is controlled:
Now let me see lines 970-1000 more carefully, and then check what happens after the host answer panel:

Now I have a clear picture. Here's my assessment and plan:

---

## Current State Assessment

When the host is also playing (`isHostPlayer === true`), the "playing" state in [HostSession.tsx](src/pages/HostSession.tsx) renders **two blocks showing the same question and options**:

1. **Lines 971-988: Non-interactive "Question" block** — Displays the question text and all options as static `<div>` elements (`bg-white/10 rounded-xl text-center`). No click handlers, no selection state. This is also what the audience/projector sees.

2. **Lines 991-1035: "Host Player Answer Panel"** — Renders the same question options again as interactive `<button>` elements. Has selection highlighting, lock-in button, and timer checks. But it uses monochrome styling (`bg-primary/30` for selected, `bg-white/5` otherwise) — no colorful option gradients like players get.

So the host sees the **question + options listed twice** vertically, which is the confusing duplication you're describing.

By contrast, the **Player view** ([PlayerSession.tsx](src/pages/PlayerSession.tsx) lines 490-510) renders options just once with colorful gradients (`from-red-500`, `from-blue-500`, `from-yellow-500`, `from-green-500`).

---

## Proposed Plan

**When the host is also playing (`isHostPlayer && !presentationMode`):**

1. **Hide the static non-interactive question options grid** (lines 977-987) — keep only the question text heading visible, remove the duplicate non-clickable option cards.

2. **Restyle the Host Answer Panel options** to match the player's colorful gradient buttons (`from-red-500 to-red-600`, `from-blue-500 to-blue-600`, etc.) with proper selection ring and opacity states, matching the PlayerSession styling.

3. **Simplify the answer panel** — remove the "Your Answer / host name" header section (it's already shown in the page header as "Playing as {name}") and integrate the lock-in button as a full-width button below the options, matching the player's "Lock In Answer" style.

**When host is NOT playing (or in presentation mode):** No change — the static question block stays as-is since it's the projector/display view.

**Files changed:** Only [src/pages/HostSession.tsx](src/pages/HostSession.tsx). No backend changes needed.

Want me to go ahead with this plan?
Ok revisit the files now after the changes

data.reasoningText: The user wants me to re-examine the current state of the HostSession.tsx file since they mentioned "other work going on right now" earlier, and changes may have been made since I last looked. Let me re-read the relevant sections.

data.content: Now let me also check the PlayerSession option colors and lock-in button more carefully to make sure I replicate them faithfully:
Now let me check the PlayerSession `optionColors` definition:

Good, the player option colors have been updated since my last look (now using muted `bg-*-900/40` instead of the bright gradients). Let me now read the rest of the HostSession playing section to confirm the full scope:

Now I have the full updated picture. Here's the updated assessment:

---

## Updated Assessment

The structure is essentially unchanged from my last review. In the "playing" state for a host-who-is-also-playing, [HostSession.tsx](src/pages/HostSession.tsx) renders:

1. **Lines 974-988: Static question block** — Question heading + a grid of non-interactive `<div>` option cards (`bg-white/10 rounded-xl text-center`). No click handlers, no colors.

2. **Lines 991-1035: Host Answer Panel** — The same options repeated as interactive `<button>` elements with monochrome styling (`bg-slate-600/30` when selected, `bg-white/5` otherwise). Includes a small "Lock Answer" button.

The player view in [PlayerSession.tsx](src/pages/PlayerSession.tsx) now uses muted colored backgrounds: `bg-red-900/40`, `bg-blue-900/40`, `bg-amber-900/40`, `bg-emerald-900/40` — with `ring-2 ring-white/30` for selected, and a full-width "Lock In Answer" / "Answer Locked" / "Time Expired" bar.

## Plan (unchanged logic, updated to match current styles)

**When `isHostPlayer && !presentationMode`:**

1. **Remove the static options grid** from the Question block (lines 977-987) — keep the question text heading, just remove the duplicate non-clickable option divs below it.

2. **Restyle the Host Answer Panel buttons** to use the same muted color scheme as PlayerSession (`bg-red-900/40`, `bg-blue-900/40`, `bg-amber-900/40`, `bg-emerald-900/40`) with `ring-2 ring-white/30` when selected, `opacity-80 hover:opacity-100` when not.

3. **Replace the small "Lock Answer" button** with a full-width bar matching the player's "Lock In Answer" / "Answer Locked" / "Time Expired" treatment.

4. **Remove the "Your Answer / host name" sub-header** in the answer panel (it's redundant — the page header already says "Playing as {name}").

**When host is NOT playing (or in presentation mode):** No change — the static question+options block stays as-is.

**Only file modified:** [src/pages/HostSession.tsx](src/pages/HostSession.tsx)

Ready to proceed when you are.

data.content:
Build passes cleanly. Here's what changed in [src/pages/HostSession.tsx](src/pages/HostSession.tsx):

**Static question block** — the non-interactive options grid is now conditionally hidden when the host is playing (`isHostPlayer && !presentationMode`). Only the question text heading remains. In presentation mode or host-only mode, the static options still display as before.

**Host answer panel** — completely restyled:
- Removed the "Your Answer / host name" sub-header (redundant with the page header)
- Option buttons now use the same colored backgrounds as the player view: red, blue, amber, emerald (`bg-*-900/40`)
- Selected state uses `ring-2 ring-white/30` instead of the old monochrome border
- Disabled/locked states match the player's opacity treatment
- Replaced the small "Lock Answer" button with a full-width "Lock In Answer" bar, plus "Answer Locked" and "Time Expired" states — all matching the player experience
